headline: Fish Chowder
description: This fish chowder recipe is an old-fashioned soup with potato and mushroom in a light broth flavored with Old Bay, clam juice, and crumbled bacon.

video.description: The fishermen of Bodega Bay shared this 5-star chowder recipe
video.name: Fish Chowder

name: Fish Chowder
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds cod, diced into 1/2 inch cubes
0.125 teaspoon Old Bay Seasoning TM, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large stockpot over medium heat. Sauté onions, mushrooms, and celery in butter until tender. Add chicken stock and potatoes; simmer for 10 minutes. Add fish; simmer for another 10 minutes.
Mix together clam juice and flour in a small bowl until smooth; stir into soup and simmer for 1 minute. Season with Old Bay, salt, and pepper. Remove from heat and stir in evaporated milk.
Portion into soup bowls and top with crumbled bacon.

review.reviewBody: Even my buddy who owns a restaurant raved about this. I used heavy cream instead of evaporated milk, and added a couple cans of chopped clams and a dozen large shrimp cut in thirds. Skipped the bacon, there was plenty of flavor and protein without it. Made it 3 times so far, excellent every time.
Great taste, added extra 2 cups chicken broth because I had one open, only 1 of the evap milk, added 1/2 tsp thyme, bay leaf, extra bay seasoning, used cod and monk fish ( was in freezer).
I always use cod when I make this. My favorite chowder recipe. It will never be bland if you use enough Old Bay!
It's a gooand 1/2 cup od recipe. I added a bay leaf, thyme and a half cup of dry white wine.
I added sherry, shrimp and extra spices.
Absolutely delicious! Keeper! Best chowder I ever had! I substituted half and half instead of the evaporated milk only because that is what I had on hand.

Great base, however I started with onions and celery in rather more butter than it called for. Cooked the potatoes separately in a small amount of water. Made a roux with the flour in the butter, onions, and celery. Added salt and pepper. Then when onions were clear, I added the potato water, but held out the potatoes. Added a cup of heavy cream and stirred it in, then 2 cups filtered water because it was a little thick. Then added more salt and pepper. Then potatoes. Then cream of mushroom soup because I did not have mushrooms. Took a leftover filet of Covina and cut it in chunks and added it. Added a little more salt and pepper. And some onion powder. Then stirred and put the lid on and let everything heat up. My four year old gran loved it! Be sure you get enough salt and pepper. And its thick and creamy. I didn't fancy condensed milk. Also cooked some bacon and crumbled on top. I thought it was delicious.

This came out great but I made a few changes. I chopped up the bacon and cooked it in the stock pot, then added the onions, celery, mushrooms and 1 TBSP of butter to the bacon and drippings, and cooked the mixture together until the vegetables were softened. I used 1.5 TSP of Old Bay seasoning and added two tablespoons of dry sherry which was a nice enhancement. I used two cans of evaporated milk but next time I will use only one - the second can really wasn't necessary. Will definitely make this again!

This could've been a 4-star recipe, but to me there is one glaring problem - the mushrooms. The texture was unpleasant and disconnected from the other things going on in this chowder. I love mushrooms, but this didn't seem like the right home for them. I also think it needed a LOT more seasoning than it called for, so make sure you taste before serving.
Great reviews at the dinner table. Substituted leeks, sauteed in butter and bacon fat,and Calabria fish.

Great Recipe. Made this with shrimp, can clams and halibat. Next time I will add a cup less of water as I found it a bit runny or like others increase your flour to thicken further. I will make this again.
I added half a can of jalapeños. I had frozen hoki fish that I needed to use. So GOOD
I added 4 cloves of garlic and cooked the onions and mushrooms in some white wine. best /easiest recipe to date !!!
Very easy to make and tasty. I love Old Bay. It’s perfect in this recipe.
Delish! Can't wait to have it again! Used Slap Yo Mamma vs Ole Bay and may use more cod next time.

This was good and a nice way to use up some fish and scallops I had in the freezer. I followed the recipe but instead of adding flour, I left my potatoes fairly large and mashed them a bit and then only used 1/2 of one can of evaporated milk. I did not have mushrooms so I simply left them out. I think they would have made this even better. I did use more Old Bay. I will made this again.
First time ever making fish chowder, this was FANTASTIC. I used heavy cream instead of evap milk. Good stuff.
The seasonings were just right! Love this recipe!

This turned out very tasty! I used a lb of cod and a pound of shrimp to coax my family to eat it (they like shrimp but not so much fish). I bought a pound of frozen raw deveined peeled shrimp and threw that in frozen before the cod. I also doubled the Old Bay seasoning and added some cayenne pepper. Because I only had one can of evaporated milk, I used a cup of Half and Half. Everyone liked it—even those not keen on fish. Will definitely make again as a welcome change from chicken soups and beef stews.
I made the soup exactly as written and added A LOT of pepper as someone had recommended (just keep tasting as you add) and this soup was AMAZING. Thank you!!!

Yum - my family enjoyed this over a winter weekend. I added 1/2 c. of bacon bits to the chowder instead of just sprinkling them on a serving. I didn't have clam juice, so just mixed the flour with water.

This recipe was easy to follow and the final product was very comforting! I added corn for some added texture and the optional bacon was great touch. Once you add the fish, be sure to stir the soup very slowing and gently as the fish will break apart.
Amazing

This recipe is delicious. I’m from New England and missed having a really good chowder now that I live in Arizona. This was exactly what I was looking for. I used frozen cod that I thawed before cooking. I omitted the mushrooms and bacon. It was a hit with my roommates. Definitely a do it again recipe!
Very good but I did have to increase the seasonings at the end (more salt, pepper & old bay). I increased to a couple extra celery sticks, a whole 8 oz container of mushrooms & 1 stick of butter.
I ended up putting in a teaspoon of Old Bay. I also used 1 pound of tilapia and one pound of Sea Food Medley (octopus, clam, squid and shrimp. It was great!!

After reading many of the reviews, I decided to make a "montage` based upon this recipe. I decided to add clams and creamed corn to the recipe and replace the Old Bay with a "Chilau" powder I recently purchased via Facebook.

The first curve ball I encountered was when I opened the Cod. We've been buying our groceries via Quicklist, and I did not check the fish when it arrived. Instead of receiving the 2 lbs I requested, I received about .85 lbs. I guess that was all they had. Well, we quickly thawed a pound of frozen shrimp to make up the difference. I followed the cooking instructions, adding the corn, clams and shrimp about 5 minutes after the fish.

I probably used 2 tbs of Chilau powder, which is already a stronger flavor than Old Bay. It was great in this role.. it also brings a subtle heat with it. Because of all the extras, I used only one can of the evaporated milk.The texture and consistency was great. Not soupy but not pasty.

This was outstanding. My wife (who is from Maine) gave it 9 out of 10 stars. I think the recipe here makes a great base and you could probably make any kind of seafood-based chowder with this.

Have made multiple times - great comfort food. 
Add Tabasco, shrimp, scallops
Serve w/sourdough bread

Nice way to use up leftover fish. I halved Reciepe...4 servings, I didn’t want to open a whole bottle of clam juice for 1/2 C, so used some left over homemade clam chowder. Also didn’t use evaporated milk, but reg whole instead.

It was amazing!!! I personally would skip out on the celery next time, but otherwise, absolutely delicious. I did use a few alternative ingredients to bring down the sodium mg, so I had to add a little more seasoning to make up for it. I highly recommend this chowder. I'm not a beginner cook, so in terms of ease, it wasn't too bad, but if you're a beginner, I would work up to this recipe. Not saying you can't do it, but there could be some points of frustration.
It was delicious easy to make and tons of flavor
We have 4 young kids and everyone loved this!!
Very good! Didn’t deviate from the recipe. The entire family enjoyed it.

This recipe was really good. Even my husband, who isn’t a huge fish fan, liked it. I think you could use any seafood in place of the fish. It was very filling and we ate it as our main course and salad as a side. I didn’t have any clam juice, so I took a can of sardines, boiled it in water for about 20 minutes, strained out the fish and used the stock instead.

Delicious recipe! I’ve never made chowder before. I followed the recipe exactly, and it turned out great! My husband is a big fan of clam or fish chowder at restaurants. He thought it was just as good as a restaurant and said he would gladly eat it again. Highly recommend this recipe!
I added one step by making a roux with bacon fat and used it for a thickener .
My family loves this recipe so much! It makes a lot, so I always bring some to my parents and grandparents. I've made it twice so far, and I'll be continuing to make it in the future!!

Complete winner. Increased celery and mushrooms but cut onion in half due to personal preference. My cod was still partially frozen when I put it in so I adjusted cooking time. Used entire bottle of clam juice and increased flour in proportion. Whole family loved it, even those who don’t love fish. If there is any leftover tomorrow I’ll try to freeze it just to see how it thaws. If it thaws well, next time I’ll double the recipe so I can freeze quarts for later meals.
I used low sodium chicken broth and I added a diced carrot.
I used this as a base recipe and made changes with what I had on hand. Skipped the clam juice, mushrooms and bacon. I garnished with cilantro and red bell pepper. Very good.
Very flavorful and filling soup. It is worth the preparation.
Added some clams and other spices and corn.

Wonderful chowder recipe that I use as a base. Today I had about a pound each of frozen striper and black sea bass from last summers fishing. I also add about a half cup of Chardonnay to the recipe, and always substitute half and half or light cream instead of canned milk. No mushrooms handy, they always add a yummy depth, but this still rocked the family tonight.
GOOD!
This doesn't need the milk. It's an excellent Manhattan version! Made mine with crab, clams and mini shrimp.
I made it with bacon and 3 types of fish: cod, trout, and catfish. I also used whole milk instead of condensed milk. It's excellent. Very flavorful, especially the cod.

This I will make again. Didn't change much. I added 1 tbls. of Old Bay and used chicken stock instead of clam juice since we do not like clams. I used heavy cream in stead of evaporated milk. Used cod and shrimp. Would cut cod into chunks, cod kind of disappeared when cut into one-half inch pieces. Very good recipe. Oh, I also added a can of creamed corn, glad I did, it added to the flavor

Absolutely delicious! I didn’t add the mushrooms and added more Old Bay. As well, we used crappie instead of cod as we are avid fishermen! My husband raved over it and I loved it! Can’t wait to share this with friends!

Excellent ... after reading the reviews, I added bacon , 1 can of creamed corn, and a bit over a tablespoon of old bay seasoning in step 4. I used 16 oz of half and half instead of the evaporated milk. I'll definitely be using this recipe again! The possibilities of combinations of seafood are endless. This time, I used cod, salmon and crab.
I used Yellow Tail. It was Great!!!

I t was easy. The flavor did not "pop." Perhaps I was a little to easy with the Old Bay Seasoning? One person thought it lacked flavor so I added more Old Bay Seasoning, and the next person thought it was too spicy. I will try it again.
awesome recipe...added a few things: half of a small bonnet pepper, pinch of smoke paprika, roasted corn kernels.
I made half the recipe . It was delicious. I will definatly make it again.
I don’t put mushrooms in, add a couple of carrots, and use one can of Carnation milk. And about a tsp of Old Bay.
I added carrots, mushrooms, shrimp and clams. My husband loved it!
Super easy and flavorful. Used cod, medium shrimp and bay scallops, added 1 diced carrot, 1tsp chicken bullion, no salt and full tsp old bay and lots of black pepper.
Fabulous.
This was really really good. Made as directed except I used low sodium chicken stock and no-salt in place of salt. I also mixed in some crab meat with the cod. Goes good with oyster crackers.

Since I bought my Cod at Costco, I had more than the recipe called for so I tryied to compensate by adding more liquid from 5 cans of clams. Then I added the clams. Delicious. I did add some Creole Seasoning which gave it some heat, and I had a full two teaspoon fulls of Bay Seasoning. Will definitly make this again.

Easy and fairly quick to make!! I followed other suggestions and I added shrimp, scallops and clams. I also through in a bay leaf and some dried thyme with the chicken broth and the potatoes. I added a full T of Old Bay’s. Delicious and a keeper!!
I made it several times and have added shrimp and used 1/2 cod & 1/2 tilapia. Added some corn also. Served with hot sauce and a little shredded cheese.

I really liked this recipe. I needed a bit more spice so added about a 1/2 tsp of Old Bay rather than an 1/8 tsp. I used cod and tilapia because I had some in the freezer. It worked very well. I would definitely make this again!
Very good and easy to make. Cut back on chicken broth and added an extra cup of clam nectar instead. Next time would add a mixture of seafood rather than just the cod and maybe some frozen corn.

One of my favorite fish chowder recipes. First time making a recipe I usually follow it exactly. Second time I made this, I tweaked the recipe a little by using clam sauce instead of clam juice and adding a dash of sherry.
This turned out great and will definitely make again!
My husband is so picky. His comment was, throw away the canned soups in the pantry, this is awesome. I was thrilled!
I substituted more chicken broth for the clam juice. I cut back to 1/4 cup of flour the second time I made it so it wasn't quite as thick.
Good recipe. I used 1 potato and substituted 1 package of frozen okra. Also added 11/2 cube of Knorrs shrimp boulion.
I made the recipe exactly as it’s written and found it to be quite boring. It was edible but I will never make it again. I feel like it was a total
Absolutely wonderful. Everyone loved it. Read the suggestions by Kaytay and added minced clams, shrimp, cream corn, 1/2 & 1/2. This is a keeper. Definitely will make again

Great soup. added clams and the juice. Used whitefish and scallops. Added small amount of thyme. I seasoned and added bacon while veggies sweated down. Used corn starch instead of flour also. This is my favorite fish chowder

Really good! This is a very healthy chowder recipe, I did make my own Old Bay seasoning (from this site) otherwise I basically followed the recipe. My fish was already cooked so I added it after the flour/clam juice and milk.
Fantastic dish! My whole family loved it!

I'm from Maine so I like to think I know a thing or two about chowder and this recipe is fantastic! I followed it exactly except I added a pound of cooked bacon because in Maine ALL chowder has bacon in it :) Thanks so much for submitting this!
It came out delish, definitely a keeper
Excellent! I substituted half and half instead of evaporated milk like others recommended and it was delicious. We sprinkled chopped jalapeno on top.
Made it twice, added a splash of sherry, some grated nutmeg and a few sprigs if thyme.
I made this my family loved it and it tastes just as good reheated. I used what fish we had in the freezer which was tilapia and mahi mahi.

We really enjoyed this soup! It was super easy to make, tasted very rich without a great deal of fat, and you can use just about any kind of fish. I didn't have clam juice so I used a chicken bouillon and I didn't have old bay so I used a little dried tarragon (about .5 teaspoon) which is a nice herb to use with seafood. I will add this to my regular soup rotation!

Was awesome! I made this with some fresh Cusk (North Atlantic cod type fish) I had caught the day before and it came out terrific! 
Note: easy with the pepper, you can easily make it a little too spicy.
great, only changes.... i sauted minced garlic bout 2 table spoons added at the end. used 1 and half tablespoons of bay spice. 18% cream instead of evap milk.
Very nice. I threw the clams in with the juice for a little extra flavor.
Delicious! I followed the recipe exactly as prescribed but accidentally bought and had to use vegetable broth and I added some fresh corn on the cob I had in the fridge. I didn’t have bacon on hand.
Awesome !!!!! I made this as written except without the bacon and doubled the veggies ....Everyone loved it...Also great with the addition of salmon and crab...

A cool rainy spring evening and I need soup! Had most of the ingredients and this seemed like the taste I was after. Turned out delicious with cod and shrimp. I did not have mushrooms (they seemed wrong anyway) or clam juice (used water). Took other reviewers suggestions for Worchestershire and Sirracha but after it was all together and I determined what else it needed - for me. I think the seasoning as listed would be fine for many but as with All Recipes it is great to adjust to personal taste. Now wish a had a nice crusty loaf to go with this! Next time I will be prepared.

This chowder was amazing! Great base recipe, I followed pretty close. In place of the butter I fried the bacon and used the bacon fat to saute the onion and celery. Then used the juice from a can of clams and added the clams to the soup and a little more Old Bay. Delish!
Absolutely loved this soup! Even without the bacon. Had some Whiting I didn't like on its own so I figured I'd use it in the chowder. Off the charts good - no more canned chowder for me!
Used pollock and seasoned with crushed chili pepper for heat! Great recipe.
No changes done the first time. Maybe I ‘d add some clams in the future.
I really liked it. I only added 1 cup of evap milk and about 1+ tsp Old Bay. I also gave it a shot of white wine. I added scallops and a can of clams and I thought it was wonderful.
This was absolutely the best fish chowder every . My whole family loved it. Thanks for sharing the recipe

So creamy and super easy. I used whiting as we had excess in the freezer. Cut the many small fillets that were frozen together into big chunks and added as they were. Did cook a few minutes longer as they thawed and broke up. While this didn't give many large pieces of fish, it was delicious. Try adding bit of freshly ground pepper when serving. I made a half recipe and it was perfect for our dinner.

Very flavorful, thick, and satisfying. A lovely family meal on a cold day. This recipe also lends itself to a bit of personalizing; I added less potatoes and included some shrimp to make it a bit less carby. It was just as tasty.
Great way to use up extra fish in the freezer.
It came out fine with no changes
It was delicious. I changed it a bit tho. Sautéed the vege in chopped bacon added garlic and sprinkled the flour to make a roux. It was yummy. I used deboned northern pike.
increase old bay seasoning to 2 teaspoons, Added 1 t Lawrys seasoned salt, 1 teaspoon hot sauce...Substituted 12 oz whole milk for 1 can of evaporated milkllll It was wonderful

I added quite a bit more Old Bay Seasoning and also Seafood Seasoning...You should taste along the way as this can be "bland". Used bacon crumbles while cooking as per another suggestion and I luv plenty of onions...Used catfish nuggets, cod and baby shrimp...Other than that, pretty good..Also used seafood stock instead of chicken stock as I had it on hand
Followed the recipe as written and it was delicious!
